item.title: Culturomics
item.description: Recently, scholars have begun to draw on the massive amounts of text data made available through Google’s large-scale book digitization project in order to track the development of cultural concepts and words over the last two centuries, announcing a new field of research named “culturomics” by its originators. However, these initial studies have been (rightly) criticized for not referring to relevant work in linguistics and language technology. Nevertheless, the basic premise of this endeavor is eminently timely.
